column7: DATA mostly from here: http://www.curioustaxonomy.net/ with some checking up on years of publication for description. Attenborough section is incomplete and there are more delights on that website
Charles Darwin is probably the most eponymized person in biology, with more than 220 species and at least 24 genera named after him

There are over 300 taxa from nine phyla named after him (Mili?i? et al. 2011). These include over 250 species, many genera (e.g., ostracod Darwinula or hemipteran Darwinysius) but also some higher ranks like the ostracod Infraorder Darwinulocopina (Sohn 1988).
